website_summaries.verdict: Pretty much what you'd expect from Bose: great sound and a high price to match.
pros: The sound is nothing short of phenomenal, and the adjustable noise cancellation works very well
In-line mic for phone calls and in-line volume control
cons: Those who brave the sticker shock love them, though

website_summaries.verdict: These sleek over-ear headphones are one of Bose's most innovative creations and include adjustable noise cancellation and the sound quality the brand is famous for.
pros: Wireless headphones
You can adjust the level of noise cancellation
Up to 20 hours of wireless play time
Connects to Amazon Alexa
Comfortable to wear
Excellent sound quality
Controls on the headphones and in the Bose app
cons: Headphones pick up external noise during phone calls, which may be distracting for the person you're talking to

website_summaries.verdict: Sleek noise-cancelling model from one of the world’s leading audio experts.
pros: Isolation from external sound provides better listening for music and calls
No deterioration in sound with increased volume
Easy Bluetooth pairing
Compatible with Alexa, Google Assistant, and Siri for voice control
cons: Some owners have had issues with noise cancelling functionality

website_summaries.verdict: A high-end pair of noise-cancelling headphones from the company that invented noise-cancelling headphones.
pros: Bose's headphones offer 3 levels of noise cancellation to make this unit more adaptable to your environment
The headphones also have a dual-microphone system for a cleaner sound, are Alexa-enabled, and feature hassle-free Bluetooth pairing
cons: There are a few minor technological bugs that can occasionally result in a diminished user experience when it comes to audio quality and connectivity

website_summaries.verdict: Existing QC35 owners don't need to upgrade, but the addition of a dedicated Google Assistant button gives the already excellent wireless noise-canceling headphone an extra bit of personality.
pros: The Bose QuietComfort 35 II headphone adds a dedicated button for Google Assistant, but it can be programmed for other functions, too
Retains its predecessor's top-of-the-line active-noise canceling, excellent wireless Bluetooth sound and extra-comfortable design
Works in wired mode with included cord if battery dies
cons: same apparent design and performance as previous model

website_summaries.verdict: Now with Google Assistant, Bose's latest pair of QuietComfort headphones, the QC35 II, is the best pair of wireless noise-canceling headphones you can buy.
pros: Powerful audio performance with deep bass response and sculpted highs
Best-in-class noise cancellation, with new on-ear controls to adjust settings
On-ear access to Google Assistant
Can be used in passive mode
cons: Highly sculpted sound signature not for purists
DSP has major impact on audio at top volumes

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT UPDATE THE FIRMWARE
customer_reviews.text: These headphones were great until I updated the firmware, through the Bose App. The active noice cancelling (ANC) worked amazingly well until I updated the headphones as recommended by Bose. Since updating, I can now hear all background noise in all environments. People talking, the TV... I am now returning these to Amazon for said reason.
customer_reviews.author: Will

customer_reviews.title: Not noise cancelling
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these thinking that for £330 they would be noise cancelling. Instead, they are "mildly noise reducing". I can hear people talking in the room, the television, and the dog... Not what I wanted. I ordered another pair to check that the first lost wasn't a dud (after speaking to Bose who suggested that they were faulty) and no, it's just how they are built. Nowhere close to being worth the money when THEY DO NOT CANCEL NOISE.
customer_reviews.author: Yossarian

customer_reviews.title: Don't spend less for less.
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely outstanding piece of kit. Everything has already been covered in other reviews, so I'll just sum up by saying sound is excellent, comfort is excellent (used for a full trip to Australia), noise-cancelling is best in the market. After trying these other headphones just don't stack up. I love them.
customer_reviews.author: mr martin l

customer_reviews.title: Noise cancelling is fab and Sound great. Durability though...
customer_reviews.text: An honestly fantastic pair of headphones. Best I’ve ever had. But durability is a concern. After owning them 8 months, the cushions starting flaking and now the inner foam is visible. I’ve been in contact with Bose Support for the last few weeks. At the moment they’re suggesting I buy some third party replacements. In general, support has been poor, not clear and very circular. Quite disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Niblett

customer_reviews.title: If you can afford it, and love great sound, go for it
customer_reviews.text: Just incredible. I mean, you get what you pay for, but these are just epic. I work in an open office, and this allows my to completely block out all distractions even without music playing. Comfortable, light, and they charge fast. They get a bit warm on your ears, but to be expected. The only thing I would change is to make the charging port a usb C rather than micro usb.
customer_reviews.author: Dert Merchant

customer_reviews.title: The best headphones every
customer_reviews.text: Can't recommend these enough. For a person who travels they are simply a nessesity. Planes, trains and any noisy environment. Perfect for blocking out all the unwanted noise. Don't let the hefty price put you off. I had to save to get mine. Well worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: Brianq

customer_reviews.title: Best headphones by far
customer_reviews.text: I dont normally review but I have had these headphones for over a week now and they are great. I use them all the time even while exercising. The noise cancellation is great and using the app you can control the degree of sound cancellation for the different circumstance and settings to suit your requirements.Phone calls are clear and communication via Alexa and google are a great feature .I buy and try a lot of tech stuff but bose is the best by far in this instance . You won't be disappointed .
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Pretty Great
customer_reviews.text: High quality, classy headphones. ANC, sound quality and build are pretty great. The Bose Connect app is a surprisingly nice addition. I don't care much for the Google Assistant button but I remapped it to control ANC levels instead via the app and now I use it all the time.
customer_reviews.author: shanesully

customer_reviews.title: Up there with the best
customer_reviews.text: I have good speakers and some other good sounding headphones, so I appreciate good audio quality. These are beautiful, light and comfortable to wear. As with the aforementioned appreciation of sound quality which these have, the noise cancellation of these is amazing, thus, boosting the sound quality of these in environments with ambient noise that these can seriously minimise - I played some music through these in two noisy pub environments, and they virtually cut it all out. Very impressed, they look, feel and sound beautiful.
customer_reviews.author: P. Whelan

customer_reviews.title: Useless. No noise cancellation
customer_reviews.text: Noise cancellation DOES NOT WORK. I can hear conversation, engine noise and basically all surrounding background sounds, just very slightly deadened. This is on the 'high' setting. Useless for travel. Useless in an office. Extremely angry at Bose for reducing quality like this.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Broke after less than a year. Bose support is good.
customer_reviews.text: Update: (upgraded to 4 stars) Bose UK, has been great and sorted me out with a replacement. Definitely comforting to know they stand by their products. Original: As a Bose fan I was a bit non-plussed with the quality of my QC35.'s Less than a year in and the protein leather foam has come undone. Also there is a bit of a "rattling" noise in the left ear.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: Hands down the best noise cancelling headphones
customer_reviews.text: Really impressed with the noise cancelling, if that's what you're looking for then these are the best. I have had other noise cancelling ones in the past, but these are amazing. I'm slightly nervous about the way the band bends and worried about breaking them. It might be the case that they feel delicate, but are actually quite durable, time will tell. I'm happy with the sound quality and the battery life is VERY good, although there's 1 disappointing thing.. that you don't appear to be able to charge and listen to them at the same time, which is odd.
customer_reviews.author: Jamescl13

customer_reviews.title: Bose
customer_reviews.text: Original n legit.. I am proud of my self coz the first I am confused between bose n Sony w 1000 but my choice goes to bose n it is awesome
customer_reviews.author: Sintong Hutabarat

customer_reviews.title: Great Headphones but...
customer_reviews.text: These headphones are very comfortable and the sound quality is great. However, I don't give them 5 stars because there is a problem with the bluetooth signal, I don't know why there is a lag with the sound... I can notice this when i am watching a movie or using the headphones with an electric guitar amplifier. The sound just takes a bit longer and its quite annoying, especially if you are playing an instrument. This is quite disappointing and I didn't expect a bug of this kind from a brand like Bose... I have checked online and I am not the only one with this issue.
customer_reviews.author: AndresKdr

customer_reviews.title: Noise Cancellation does not work at all
customer_reviews.text: I have work colleagues that have the Series I of these and the noise cancellation works a treat - people talking in the room and you don't hear a thing. So impressive I bought a pair. Unfortunately I could only get the Series II and it seems (as many other reviewers have said before me) that Bose have changed something, because the noise cancellation SIMPLY DOES NOT WORK! Perhaps its poor quality control and some sets work, but who can be bothered to keep returning them, or risk them stopping working after a few months? You can get better quality for the same price from a different brand.
customer_reviews.author: andrew

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing
customer_reviews.text: Noise reduction not a patch on Sony phones I had previously. Sound is nothing special. Completely underwhelmed.
customer_reviews.author: W. Parsons

customer_reviews.title: excellent commuter headphones
customer_reviews.text: noise cancelling is quite amazing. I've never tried phase cancelling headphones before and it's remarkable. They're comfortable, light and work really well with google. A bit pricey but they are pretty good.
customer_reviews.author: Ian M. Taylor

customer_reviews.title: My son can't hear me
customer_reviews.text: Boy number 2 wanted these headphones as his main present from Santa this Christmas. And Santa delivered because he was on the good boy list due to him doing so well at school. Sadly though, he can no longer hear me. I shout him to tell him that I have lovingly prepared a delicious meal for him to eat but get no reply because he cannot hear me. I have resorted to sending him text messages with suitable emojis to let him know that dinner is read. My current favourite of the fire emoji and the dog face - can you guess what dinner was that night? Boy number 2 thinks they are great, the headphones and the hot dogs!
customer_reviews.author: Cundykj

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the price tag due to poor bluethooth
customer_reviews.text: I won't recommend these headphones but after a lot of research and contacting Bose support I found out there are some batches in the wild that have hardware connectivity issues. I kept getting drops and stuttering on a lot of different devices and did everything I could to resolve this from forgetting the device to resetting it and updating the firmware. No good. Sending for a return, would of been interested in a replacement but Amazon isn't offering it now they are back to full price.
customer_reviews.author: Katie

customer_reviews.title: I love these headphones
customer_reviews.text: These headphones help me focus at work. I'm lucky to have an office job where I can wear headphones. They block out the distracting conversations, or any other type of annoying noise. Sound quality is really good. I bought them because I work in a noisy office but I also use them at home so I can listen to podcasts while cooking for example. I dropped them once and I was really worried they might have broken, but I realised they weren't made of cheap plastic. They're quite solid. I'll still be as careful as I possibly can to not drop them again.
customer_reviews.author: Mr Hammer

customer_reviews.title: Buying the Bose Q35 headphones was an expensive mistake
customer_reviews.text: I bought the Bose Q35 headphones around 18 months ago and get increasingly disappointed with them. The audio quality is excellent but my ears get very hot making it unpleasant to use the headphones. Also, I recently tried a bluetooth transmitter to stream sound while I watched TV. Bizarrely, Bose Q35 does not support low latency bluetooth codecs so there was a time lag on the audio which was out of sync with the video. I wish I had never bought the Q35 headphones and had spent the money on another product. Unfortunately, it's probably too late to get my money back but maybe this review will stop some people wasting theirs.
customer_reviews.author: enstone

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed with constant downgrading of ANC
customer_reviews.text: I bought these headphones hoping the ANC would be as amazing as I had seen when testing my friends headphones. For the first few months it was fine but since the last firmware upgrade, the ANC has become fairly basic. I can now hear everything around me even when ANC is on. I am disappointed and would not buy Bose again. I would recommend going elsewhere. If you are thinking of buying these or any other Bose products, I would bare this in mind.
customer_reviews.author: D. K.

customer_reviews.title: Well worth the money!
customer_reviews.text: These aren’t cheap and don’t look anything stunningly special but they are the best headphones I have ever bought or used the connect easily with Bluetooth and have a very stable connection, the sound quality is superb and the noise cancellation is excellent which was proven on a recent flight with screaming kids and arguing adults nearby but with the headphones on it was absolute bliss, in my opinion well worth the money as the they do feel durable @nd well made as well and come supplied with all the cables you need in the box, definitely recommend these!
customer_reviews.author: jill adamson

customer_reviews.title: Very impressive product
customer_reviews.text: Bought as a gift for myself, recently got an iPhone 8 and needed wireless so decided to go all out. The noise cancellation is superb and the sound quality is flawless. You can wear these for hours and forget you’re wearing them! Battery life and charge times are also highlights, I only need to charge once every few days at most and they seem to be full within an hour! Hopefully will last a long time to make the investment worthwhile.
customer_reviews.author: Peter Fitch

customer_reviews.title: Good until the sound drops
customer_reviews.text: When I first got these they were amazing, fantastic sound and noise cancellation then it went downhill, dropping out ever 30 seconds tried resetting all equipment but nothing worked. This is a real shame because the sound quality is the best I have had, but I get better performance out of my £50 audiomx Bluetooth than I do from these, no drop outs on exactly the same equipment
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: Expensive but good
customer_reviews.text: I have used these headphones in conjunction with my iPhone and my LG tv. It is super easy to connect and the instructions guide you through setup very well. Battery power is good and it charges fast too. Sound quality is really good. With regards to noise cancelling, it is important to note that these are not industrial grade ear defenders. They will block out most ambient noise and you will struggle to have a decent conversation with the person next to you. But do not put your head next to a washing machine on full spin and expect it to noise cancel that! Overall I have been very satisfied with this product and glad I bought them.
customer_reviews.author: I'm late for work!

customer_reviews.title: Flawed
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted to like these headphones after all the reviews. Unfortunately, the sound didn't really blow me away. It was just okay. In fact, the Bose in-ear Bose QuietComfort 20 have much better sound. These sounded cheap by comparison. The second problem, and the deal-breaker for me, is the amount of sound leakage. I like to listen to music very loud. But with these headphones it sounds like I'm using a pair of loudspeakers. Makes it unusable for me in the office. Sorry Bose.
customer_reviews.author: Caduceus

customer_reviews.title: Don’t worry this headphones are worth money
customer_reviews.text: I was considering Sony headphones but I chose Bose. The headphones are loud enough,noise cancellation is great, battery life excellent, quality and comfort fantastic! Bluetooth connectivity super good and long range. The only one thing I don’t like is that the headphones are not super basse If my comment help you chose headphones between Bose and Sony like please Thanks
customer_reviews.author: Lechu

customer_reviews.title: What you think they will be like, they are.
customer_reviews.text: Just amazing, really good quality sound. The best thing however, is the ability to listen to music on a medium volume in a noisy atmosphere, and her it in full quality. The pay-per-month is a great feature and it honestly is one of the best purchases. Battery is great, lasts a long time. Bluetooth is a bit of a pain, they put the connector in the earpod that you change tracks/volume and it sometimes cuts out briefly. Overall: 5/5
customer_reviews.author: Fraser Sweeney

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful Sound, With One Issue
customer_reviews.text: The sound quality is simply amazing, the only limiting factor becomes the source of the audio. These things keep surprising me with how well they perform. The drivers inside are serious business, too, if you have enough bass then they'll rumble. The noise cancellation is superb, too. Paired with how light they are, taking them off almost overwhelms me since I'm suddenly reintroduced to a relatively ridiculous amount of background noise. The only issue is the bluetooth connectivity; after a while, the audio will trail behind the source. This issue isnt important when listening to music, but when watching videos it becomes jarring to see lips move but hearing the words on a split second delay. TLDR: Nearly perfect... nearly
customer_reviews.author: Justin Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Best purchase of 2019
customer_reviews.text: What an excellent product! I wasn’t very keen to spend that much money in headphones but wanted a good noise cancellation working in a busy office and now I use them daily since I leave the house in the morning until I arrive in the evening. Perfect for public transport, planes and busy offices. Still hearing colleagues’ voice in the background but this is normal with noise cancellation products and doesn’t even bother me. I’m very, very happy of having spent this money, best purchase of 2019 no doubt!
customer_reviews.author: Sandra Sánchez

customer_reviews.title: A little disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Not user friendly. The on line user manual is not good, and not easy to find what you specifically want to look at. I find them complicated to use, although once on, the sound quality is good. They only arrived today, so maybe I need time to get used to them. I find at the moment, that Alexa doesn't always work, maybe I am doing something wrong, but trying to find out is like looking for a needle in a haystack in the online instructions. It appears to be a quality product but spoiled by this lack of easy to understand instructions.
customer_reviews.author: RedRebel

customer_reviews.title: Amazing and great for noise cancelling
customer_reviews.text: Beverley I know this is a bold statement but these are the best headphone I've ever had and also the most expensive but worth every penny. If I was to find a fault which was very difficult for me was slightly tricky setting up but once figured it out was easy. I have suspected aspergers have ear defenders but didn't quite help as my dog ate them and they sounded louder hah. These are amazing can adjust how much noise you can cancel out I now have a jelous partner lol
customer_reviews.author: Miss N L Reay

customer_reviews.title: Love quiet - love these
customer_reviews.text: I take these to work as I work in an open-plan office (someone's brainchild to make people communicate better - ends up people wearing head/ear phones due to the constant chatter, & people just end up skyping one another instead - even when next to each other LOL!) Just noise cancelling cuts out 90% of the background... but when a gentle song/music from the phone via bluetooth is employed.... concentration heaven!! Love the sound quality & battery life... have used them @ home with gaming.... superb sound range
customer_reviews.author: Phil S

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: I love these headphones! They are comfortable, the sound quality is excellent as is the noise cancelling. The battery life between charges is excellent and the carry case is very protective. I have had the series 1 for nearly 4 years. I bought these for my wife to replace some cheaper sennheiser headphones I bought her for her birthday. They were very disappointing compared to the Bose headphones so I returned them and decided to spend the extra money on what is in my opinion a far superior product.
customer_reviews.author: JB

customer_reviews.title: Excellent sound quality and strong noise cancellation
customer_reviews.text: These were a Christmas present to replace a pair of Sony MDR-1RBTs that provided really good sound quality but were pre noise cancellation technology. So its very early days yet; however, these Bose provide even better sound reproduction and very strong noise cancellation. I can now work without being disturbed by the neighbours:-) They appear to be robustly constructed and are comfortable to wear; furthermore, with a 20 hour play time they give me more than enough life between charges. I am very pleased with my gift and would recommend these headphones!!
customer_reviews.author: Gary C.

customer_reviews.title: Great at noise cancelling
customer_reviews.text: As noise cancelling headphones these are near perfect. Great at eliminating constant background noise like trains or airplane engines. Nearly as good at reducing people having conversations nearby too. As high-quality headphones, they are very good but not the best to my ears. I find the sound of my Sennheiser HD 25s superior. The HD 25s are just a bit cleaner sounding, although to be fair that could just be down to the processing that the noise cancelling introduces. Overall strongly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Edward Lynch

customer_reviews.title: Natural sounding headphones and good ANC. (used mainly for the TV)
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product, I have had Bose headphones in the past and the quality remains. Good ANR and natural sound (I use it mainly for the TV) maybe "overkill" but I have noisy neighbours. NOTE: I have not connected to the connect app. Or upgraded the software out-of-the-box. But as I don't use Alexa etc. don't need to, and I am wary due to reports of ANC degradation at latest firmware release, why risk it. UPDATE 31/05. I made the decision to upgrade to 4.5.2 via the Windows 10 app. RESULT. No discernable change in noise reduction quality, and a small amount of background hiss is gone.
customer_reviews.author: Garge

customer_reviews.title: Awesome headphones
customer_reviews.text: These headphones are awesome and don't believe any reviewer who says the noise reduction doesn't work - total B/S - it works perfectly, better than anything that Sony have managed to produce. The sound is brilliant, whether you are listening to opera, jazz, blues or black metal, and there is a wonderful balance across all the instruments and vocals. I love the Rose Gold edition, but I am sure the others are great too. It's a big improvement on the SoundLink system and worth the extra money. So, what are you waiting for?
customer_reviews.author: Taralouise

customer_reviews.title: Alright apart from one ISSUE!
customer_reviews.text: Really good sound, really good at the job they are designed for. However... with the YouTube iOS app, the lip sync is out. I've googled it and it's a known issue. Play a video from your phone or a video podcast and it's fine. But YouTube is not in sync. I've stuck with them as I don't watch much. I listen to audio from YouTube. But it is annoying for a pair of £300+ headphones. No one has a remedy. Not Sure if the SONY M3 has the same issue which was my other option.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. G

customer_reviews.title: best in class noise cancelling, blows every other pair of headphones out the water.
customer_reviews.text: The QC35 II replace my old set of Bose overeat headphones. Wow what a step up, by the far the most comfortable and best sounding headphones I have owned. You can wear these for hours with no discomfort what so ever. along side this the sound quality is a big step up from my old soundtrue set. One feature that doesn't get highlighted much is the ability to pair with 2 devices at once, makes watching a film on a iPad and then switching over to audio on a phone quick and simple. One of the best audio purchases I have made.
customer_reviews.author: Adam Holyoake

customer_reviews.title: Good investment. Bose quality as expected.
customer_reviews.text: Always buy Bose. Wanted some headphones to do strimming and cutting grass. Very good quality as with all Bose products, I would say noise cancellation very good but you can hear things around you which is good for safety etc.!! Bluetooth good but have had a couple of glitches and just put down to Bluetooth itself not headphones. They’ve definitely better then in ear phones as more comfortable and better sound. Battery last forever and really clear to receive it make phone calls through. Also quite good if you want to drain out your boyfriend or husbands voice !
customer_reviews.author: Miss Louise K Bland

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing!!
customer_reviews.text: Awful pair of headphones! Getting sent back, the bluetooth connection keeps cutting out. A £50 pair is better! Can't believe they're over £300 stay clear of these.
customer_reviews.author: Sdog1878

customer_reviews.title: Superb
customer_reviews.text: I read a number of reviews that complained about the firmware update degrading noise cancellation and while some users have been affected my installation was completely successful and I'm delighted with the result. These headphones are light, comfortable and deliver a truly exceptional sound. Noise cancellation, it doesn't get better than this, a tribute to the Bose engineers. Bluetooth, easy, no problems whether computers, iPads, iPhones or Fire tablets, buy a pair, you'll not be disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Dr. Ian Montgomery

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy them for noise cancelling
customer_reviews.text: In short - Active Noise Cancelling - terrible. Sound quality - very good, room for improvement. Comfort - decent, room for improvement (maybe I just have a tiny head?) Bluetooth connectivity - good enough, connects instantly, but drops at times. I'm really disappointed with the noise cancelling on these, as an autistic person it's actually the main reason I bought them and they block out nothing. Really, nothing. If anybody can recommend a better alternative, I would appreciate it.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle

customer_reviews.title: Truly sensational sound quality.
customer_reviews.text: Really pleased with this product. The sound quality is amazing. I’m hearing sounds in familiar songs I’ve never heard before. Great large sound and you feel like you’re in another world when you have them on. Very comfortable to wear. The battery life is brilliant. I would strongly recommend these if you are a true lover of music. Gave less for durability only because I’ve only had them a couple of months.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT UPDATE THE FIRMWARE!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Noise cancellation was great, until I updated the firmware to the latest version. Then it was basically no difference from regular £20 headphones. There's no way of rolling back to the old version. I updated it right after the free return time, so I contacted BOSE and they agreed to send me a replacement. So if you are buying this one, DO NOT UPDATE THE FIRMWARE!!!
customer_reviews.author: CXW

customer_reviews.title: Really disappointing
customer_reviews.text: After reading the reviews and considering the price I was expecting to be blown away by these. The only good thing they’ve got going for them is that they’re Bluetooth and comfortable. But the noise cancelling is very poor as it the sound quality. I was expecting nice crisp clear sound but it sounds pretty average. Which is a shame as I was expecting much better. Will be returning as they’re definitely not worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: TJS

customer_reviews.title: Good headphone in general, just dont update to 4.5.2
customer_reviews.text: Bose did a well done job. The headphone is more comfortable to wear than Sony WH for long hours. Design is slick and sound quality is good. So why did I give it 3 stars: 1) DONT UPDATE to 4.5.2. After updating, its fair to say the headphone is not noise cancelling anymore. Such a shame for this amazing headphone went garbage because of a software glitch. Apparently this happened to a lot of people too, which you can check out on sub-reddit r/bose. 2) Bose cheap out on the manufacture of the case. If you can find one below £250 then buy it and dont update the software. Otherwise don’t bother.
customer_reviews.author: Ha Nguyen

customer_reviews.title: Not cheap, but excellent sound and noise cancellation
customer_reviews.text: I bought these when I broke by previous set of headphones. I wasn't sure about spending so much on a set of headphones, but I'm so pleased that I did. The sound fantastic and combined with the auto noise cancelling you get lost in your own little world. Build quality is great as as you'd expect from Bose and the cost. They come with their own transport/storage case with is also will made and feels robust so should protect the headphones if you're in the habit of shoving them into a backpack with other stuff. Bluetooth pairing worked fine, however you need to download the Bose Connect App to get access to some additional configuration features.
customer_reviews.author: Geoff

customer_reviews.title: Very comfy with not the greatest features.
customer_reviews.text: These are super comfy and overall pretty good. Sound quality is ok - for me it's too low on bass, not great definitioon and missing the kick - I listen mostly to metal. The app is poor and quite frankly useless unless you use voice assistant. The noise cancellation is average - it reduces the white noise quite well, but speech and higher tones are all well heard. Sony WH-1000XM3 that I use at work have much better noise cancellation, but have other cons.
customer_reviews.author: Kris

customer_reviews.title: Awesome product, but...
customer_reviews.text: I love them, the sound is amazing and the sound cancellation is really good. My only problem is that the 2 pairing thing doesn't work that well. I've connect my phone and laptop to the headphones and ideally should only connect to the one who is playing a new sound. Shamefully only works if I disconnect the from the Bose app the device is not playing nothing. So, it's an extra step, and nobody likes an extra step.
customer_reviews.author: Emilio Jéldrez

customer_reviews.title: Great with some annoying imperfections.
customer_reviews.text: Great pair of headphones. Connecting devises is easy and you can add more that one at a time which is great. Noise cancelling is spot on but there are few annoyances. Firstly, they cater for those with larger heads so feels slightly lose on someone with a normal size head. Secondly the quality of the case is shocking, the way the zip sits is unacceptable for the quality position of the brand and the pouch on the back bobbles easy after being in a bag for a short amount of time.
customer_reviews.author: Todd

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!
customer_reviews.text: I had a pair of Bose Bluetooth over ear headphones but I decided to sell them and buy Powerbeats Pro’s. I instantly realised that I can’t wear earbuds so I sent them back and decided to buy a new pair of over ear headphones. After reading lots of reviews I was torn between the Bose QC35 ii and the Sony WH1000-MX3. The Sony headphones seemed to have the edge technically but I really loved my old Bose ones so I opted for the QC35’s. I’m not disappointed at all. They’re light, the battery lasts forever and they sound awesome! I’m no audiophile but I know how I like my music to sound and these live up to my expectations.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen Gray

customer_reviews.title: Great sound and great comfort must be Bose
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these for my wife as a gift for hitting the big 50 - she has to wear heating aids and often finds over the ear type to cause the high pitched “feedback” she has had wired bose ones and they are great so whilst at an airport she tried the demo ones of these and they also caused no issues. Didn’t want to purchase from the airport so once home I got them from here. Great sound and good battery life. Highly recommended. The ability to fold up and pop in their case means holidays she can enjoy her audio comfortably.
customer_reviews.author: a2sumo

customer_reviews.title: Great QUALITY headphones
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for flight to Miami and kept them on all the way they were so comfortable. Use them much of the time now at home to cancel out noise and esp in garden during lockdown. I bought them on 3 payment option and it was the thing that made my decision so easy. Knowing i could return them AFTER flight if the quality wasn't adequate. Thankfully it was. LOVE THESE HEADPHONES 😍
customer_reviews.author: Hellen St

customer_reviews.title: Not for small heads!
customer_reviews.text: Great sound awful fit. I am 5ft tall and small boned. On the smallest fitting these go onto my neck, level with the base of my jaw. Feels like I am being gripped by a giant! So uncomfortable. Not had this problem before, back to sennheiser which always fit beautifully. Return.
customer_reviews.author: zena h

customer_reviews.title: Need to do some long term comfort adjustments
customer_reviews.text: The comfort is good but maybe it’s just me, the right hand ear cup presses a bit. I’ve had them a day and I am an definitely feel that I’ve been wearing them today. That said... sound clarity is just wow! Really. Just amazing. I’ve listened through Beats, Sony Sennheiser and these just top it for me. Very good. So I’ll try stretching them over a bal to make them more comfortable for me to wear and I’ll keep them.
customer_reviews.author: S. Khan

customer_reviews.title: Loose connection inside. Bad app.
customer_reviews.text: My pair cut out sometimes when playing music. This isn't to do with Bluetooth but rather a physical loose connection. Awful app. Started going on a walk with my new phone, but couldn’t connect. I now have to walk hope to remove my old phone, I can’t do it from this app or their website. Thicko designers and managers who don’t believe in product testing. Noise cancelling great though.
customer_reviews.author: M G

customer_reviews.title: Just fantastic
customer_reviews.text: These are my first ever pair of noise cancelling headphones and - wow :-) The Bose Connect app that you need to download first was great, had the headphones Bluetooth-connected and Google Assistant all working within 5 minutes. Firmware downloaded and installed automatically. I found the sound fantastic and zero outside noise. The ear-cups foam are very comfortable. They come with the smallest USB charger cable I have ever seen though - about 8" long, and you cannot use them while they're charging, but mine came with a 70% charge. Controls are very intuitive. Very happy with purchase.
customer_reviews.author: William

customer_reviews.title: The noise cancelling is no joke.
customer_reviews.text: I love them! I couldn’t commit on a pair of headphones for the longest time. But I’m so glad I finally committed. I travel a lot. These are so perfect for shutting out the world from my door to the destination. It’s tmreakly improves my travel experience- even through airport security. And better yet, they’ve helped me sleep on a plane. Which I have never done. Although a bit bulky with a neck cushion that makes sitting a bit uncomfortable. But this easy my sorted by adjusting the neck cushion down.
customer_reviews.author: London Chick

customer_reviews.title: They are Bose. You know you are getting good headphones.
customer_reviews.text: The choice for me like so many was these or the Sony WH-1000XM3. Both same-ish price and both rated the best depending on where you read. For me the Bose were more comfortable to wear. Both had fantastic noise cancelling. As for playing music, both were very good but I thought the Sony’s sounded slightly better. I still went for these. I actually wasn’t keen on the tap/swipe function on the Sony’s, I preferred real buttons that I’d never accidentally press. I also mainly wanted them for long haul flights so comfort was important. Bluetooth range is impressive and they connect instantly to my iPhone the moment you switch them on.
customer_reviews.author: Kielo

customer_reviews.title: Great Quality Headphones
customer_reviews.text: I've had Bose headphones for years now but this is the first pair of noise cancelling ones that I've bought. They are great for blocking out everyday noise whether or not you're listening to music. The Wi-Fi works well most of the time. I find it problematic when I'm trying to listen to the TV through the headphones. The signal often cuts out and the TV sometimes goes out of sync with the sound. You can use them with a cord and I suppose that would sort out that problem. Primarily though I bought them for listening to music and for this job they are superb.
customer_reviews.author: H. Mowat

customer_reviews.title: One of the best items ever purchased
customer_reviews.text: I have tried a lot of over the head earphones and these are by far the best. These are one of my favourite items I have ever purchased, slightly expensive compared to others on the market but the quality is far superior. I use these every day for work on the train for over 2hrs each day, battery life is fantastic. Great quality and condition over 2 years of use. I have since purchased my daughter and father a pair as gifts they are so good.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: quality
customer_reviews.text: I searched really good headphones for 1.5 months and I bought that at the end, because there was a really good discount. Indeed, the product is really satisfying the users because the noise cancellation feature is one of the best in that segment. That's why I highly recommend this product. The sound could be a lil bit better, but it doesn't mean it sounds bad. On the contrary, sound, comfort, and noise cancellation combine is really high standard and easy to use. I highly recommend that headphones to those whom are looking for good sound and comfort.
customer_reviews.author: Erdem

customer_reviews.title: Not sure about the overall quality
customer_reviews.text: In terms of features, it is ok. But what bothers me that the ear cups don't look very esthetic. I mean paying this much for premium quality I would expect slightly better build quality (also, they arrived like this, this is not a used product)
customer_reviews.author: Alex Rudys

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic
customer_reviews.text: I love these. The bluetooth connection is infallible, and has never let me down. The sound is great, and the controls work consistently well and are easy to find and use. The battery lasts well, and is quick to recharge. They are very comfortable to wear, and they stay on firmly when active. The noise reduction works very well. Well worth the substantial cost.
customer_reviews.author: David Slater

customer_reviews.title: Not 100% Noise cancellation but still good.
customer_reviews.text: I really like these earphone but the noise cancellation I thought was going to better. Saying that I wouldn’t part with them. They work perfectly at blocking out noise when you are listening to music but if you are listening to audio books you will still hear background noise. Still pleased with them though.
customer_reviews.author: Sharon

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointing
customer_reviews.text: The headphones are very comfortable as most bose products are, however the sound quality isn't great for headphones of this price. The bass washes out all the rest of the sound, and it sounds like you're listening with clingfilm covering the speakers. The noise canceling is also very poor, all it does is cut a bit of the white noise, all other voices and TV can be heard clear as day through the headphones even with the noise cancellation set to high. My flight later will be a good test.
customer_reviews.author: Ben Trudgill

customer_reviews.title: Can't believe how good these headphones are
customer_reviews.text: I held of buying these for a long time due to cost but in Lockdown I wanted to be able to listen to music in bed. They are fantastic. As an added bonus the noise cancellation is good enough to reduce the noise of my electrical tools and lawn mower to a whisper. They are comfortable enough to wear all day. Works well with Google assistant or Alexa. Highly recommended
customer_reviews.author: Electronut

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!
customer_reviews.text: These are perfect! I work next to a difficult and noisy character at work which almost led to me walking out of my job! This product has saved my life!! When my colleague gets noisy, I simply put them on, and he disappears completely! YES!!!!! Oh, and of course, if I want to, I can play music too - lovely sound, but then you’d expect that from BOSE wouldn’t you! Well done & thank you!
customer_reviews.author: Mike W.

customer_reviews.title: Hot on ears and seems flimsy
customer_reviews.text: Felt very hot on the ears,build quality seemed lacking given the price and competition with the sony wh-1000x me For me it wasnt very comfortable on the ears it also doesn't come with airplane adapter
customer_reviews.author: MrWindy

customer_reviews.title: When you buy DON'T update
customer_reviews.text: Had these since March and they where great till I installed firmware 4.5.2 This basically killed the high ANC setting. Complained to Bose and they replaced them, luckily the firmware version was lower and I have no intention of updating them
customer_reviews.author: Baz

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the money in 2020
customer_reviews.text: Noise cancellation used to be better in the Bose headphones. Over time it has dwindled and the competition has become more powerful in this space. On the other hand, the traditional Bose sound comes through nicely, although it has its pitfalls. Really I see no advantage of this over mk.1 and now with Bose 700 out, these have become sort of obsolete.
customer_reviews.author: Edu Pimentel

customer_reviews.title: BEST. HEADPHONES. EVER
customer_reviews.text: Not much more to say than that - these are the best things I've ever put on my head. So much better than the Sony XM3's which I unfortunately purchased first, being a Sony fanboy for years. Boy do I regret that decision. The QC35's are the creme-de-la-creme of noise cancelling headphones... comfortable, good looking, cancel out most noise and sound immense. Perfic!
customer_reviews.author: D. L. Williams

customer_reviews.title: Very good specially for flights
customer_reviews.text: I was waiting for more than a year to buy it and finally bought it. It sounds great and I really like the feeling when I wear it. I tested it on several flights and it saved me. I always had trouble with babies crying on the airplanes which didn’t let me rest. The headphone also blocked all the engine sound and I enjoyed listening music thoughout the journey.
customer_reviews.author: Mostafa

customer_reviews.title: Good but expensive
customer_reviews.text: Very comfortable well made product. These are the most expensive headphones I've ever purchased and yes they are very good; however, they are not worth the premium price tag iwhen compared to other quality brands. Bose are like the Armani of the speaker market, realitivly good quality but you are paying for the brand more than the underlying technology.
customer_reviews.author: Jason Trinder

customer_reviews.title: Great headphones
customer_reviews.text: These are great, ive had alot of different headphones but these feel and fit comfortably and the best for me. I travel alot and just like to work or relax and listen to music. is the sound the best ive ever heard no, but its still great sound. Are they the comphiest headphones ive ever had YES by far. The feel of the materials is fantastic the case is great. the controls i love them, i like actual buttons. I would reccomend these, if your thinking about it you might aswell try it. I love them.
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: Brilliant
customer_reviews.text: These are amazing, every time I'd been through an airport I'd tried these and the previous version in duty free. Always been amazed at the noise cancellation. Decided to bite the bullet and buy these using the interest free installment option. Love them to bits. Great pair of bluetooth headphones. Been on flights and train journeys and shocked when I've removed them for a second to realise how much noise was going on, they're noise cancellation has to be the best there is.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen

customer_reviews.title: Bose QuietComfort 35 (Series II) Wireless Headphones
customer_reviews.text: Purchased these for my husband. He absolutely loves them. Puts them on when the grandchildren come round and he cant stand the sound of their programmes any longer! :) He has worn them in the garden whilst planting bulbs and whilst working on his laptop. He says that the noise cancelling is excellent and the sound quality is what he would expect from Bose. Pairing was very simple. He is very happy with them.
customer_reviews.author: Shelly

customer_reviews.title: Consistently very good.
customer_reviews.text: The ANC is simply excellent, they take some time to adjust to are there is a slight pressure feel at first on the ears. Comfort is superb, can wear for very long periods of time, as they are light and pretty solid in build. Sound quality is very good, lacks a bit in the low's, the lack of EQ is an issue. But for classical, film scores etc, they are excellent. Very consistent headphone in ANC, build quality and official cables are cheap to replace also. 8.5/10.
customer_reviews.author: S.O.

customer_reviews.title: You will not regret your purchase!
customer_reviews.text: Great sound quality, partner has the same headphones and we can share the audio playing from apps on the iPad to each others headphones when flying together. Noise cancellation is great in public surroundings where background noise is high and the sound quality is second to none, exactly what's expected from Bose and headphones of this price. Only downside is the bluetooth pairing can be temperamental at times but this will always be resolved after connecting through your phones interface instead of the headphones.
customer_reviews.author: John K

customer_reviews.title: Superb sound quality and the best noise cancellation
customer_reviews.text: I’ve always struggled with how people can justify spending £200+ on a pair of earphones, until I bought these. The noise cancellation is staggering, they are lightweight and very comfortable and the sound quality knocks spots off any other headphones I’ve tried (admittedly typically I’m buying at a quarter of this price)
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: TOP QUALITY AUDIO !!!
customer_reviews.text: Got these headphones for my wife as for years she has suffered with deafness & need the TV on very loud. She has since had her ears syringed so now her hearing is improved a lot but she still likes to watch TV wearing her headphones, No trailing wires makes them even more user friendly, plus long battery life plus very comfortable to wear for long periods.
customer_reviews.author: bushy

customer_reviews.title: Love the rose gold!!
customer_reviews.text: Love them! Husband brought them me due to mine braking all the time so he thought these would last me :) noise cancelling is good not great could be better but they are very cute I love the rose gold and very soft. You would forget your wering them when on :) love the app to control it. Love the hard case it comes with too :)
customer_reviews.author: Charlotte

customer_reviews.title: Clicking sound
customer_reviews.text: It was ok for about 1 week,then i hear this clicking noise in the right side. I thought it was just windy, but i set the noise cancelling on low and its still there, even if its off. It was very annoying, i have to return it to Amazon. Never been disappointed from bose.
customer_reviews.author: Djedearl

customer_reviews.title: All round great
customer_reviews.text: Amazing, very comfortable can be worn for hours on end without any discomfort. I use them all the time for studying In busy common areas and can’t hear noise around. Have also used them on long haul flights and these were by far the comfiest pair Of headphones I’ve used. I was able to keep them on for 12hr flight. They fit much better than The equivalent version of Beats headphones. Battery lasts for ages and Bluetooth connects to multiple devices if you want it to, which makes it easy to switch from phone to tablet.
customer_reviews.author: kenza

customer_reviews.title: Best Noise Cancelling Headphone ever
customer_reviews.text: I have owned Sennheiser and Sony Noise cancelling headphones and spent my working life on aeroplanes and trains, but the BOSE QC35 II are in a class of their own. One word of warning, if you ware them at home you are likely not to hear the phone or front door bell! As a bonus they are very comfortable to ware. They are expensive, but great value for money. Highly recommended. Amazon were best price by a mile when I purchased.
customer_reviews.author: JAF

customer_reviews.title: Noise cancelling YES!
customer_reviews.text: I had the Bose SoundLink 2 before this device! Sold and bought this one regards the noise cancelling feature! I didn't regret any penny which i had to pay more for this! Sound quality is absolutely perfect the BT connection a little bit tricky but I'm using with 2 device ( laptop and phone) so not a average user usage. The noise cancelling function is absolutely perfect! In a noise hotel room or office do the job and keep quiet and enjoyable the music on a low level volume.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Business oriented headphones
customer_reviews.text: Louder than the sennheiser ones I tried. Sound quality is good but sennheiser has better sound separation. What is all comes down to is that these are loud, bass is punchy and they are by far the most confortable. What wins points with me is that 2 can have 2 devices connected at the same time which helps when you work using a laptop and phone at the same time. Ideal for work situations where Skype and mobile rings a lot.
customer_reviews.author: Chris B

customer_reviews.title: Bose headset
customer_reviews.text: Well I tried the Bose QuietComfort 35 (Series II) Wireless Headphones, Noise Cancelling with Alexa built-in - Black, Found them easy to use, noise cancelling not as good as I thought it would be, audio was also not as great as I expected, Alexa was fine worked ok, would have expected better from Bose and for the money.
customer_reviews.author: The Guru

customer_reviews.title: An excellent piece of equipment
customer_reviews.text: The volume at maximum setting is often too low for me to hear dialogue clearly. My hearing imparement is such that I need to use hearing aids on occasions in conjunction with the headphones. Most irksome and after a while painful. Presumably volume above the max setting is damaging and bose is saving us from ourselves, most probably the younger generation whose want is to overdose and damage their hearing
customer_reviews.author: Keith Fretwell

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding performance!
customer_reviews.text: These are really excellent headphones. I have had 'cordless' headphones before, and the battery life and sound quality was never as good as corded headphones. Bose is a well known and reputable brand, so I thought I would spend the extra for the quality. I am not disappointed! Battery life is long, sound quality and noise cancellation is outstanding and they are very comfortable. I can ware these for several hours without needing a rest.
customer_reviews.author: Andy G

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: As others have said, I was hesitant buying such an expensive product but reviews online persuaded me to take the punt. I have been blown away. They are worth the price for the comfort, quality, ease of Bluetooth connection and of course the noise cancellation. I would highly recommend these.
customer_reviews.author: Jack R

customer_reviews.title: ANC Was Good... Till Software Update
customer_reviews.text: The headphones - specifically the noise cancellation were really great until performed software update. Now it's really just ambient noise being cancelled out - not good for such expensive hardware. Unimpressed. A lot of sound bleeds out when using the earphones as well
customer_reviews.author: Peter

customer_reviews.title: Not so happy
customer_reviews.text: I thought Bose would be really nice product in terms of ANC but I was wrong. I did not find the noise cancellation to be really good for Bose. On the tube, I could still hear lot of outside noise. Returned this one and bought Sony WH1000MX2 - which I prefer over this. Never has an ANC headphones and not biased between Bose/Sony.
customer_reviews.author: AmazonShopper

customer_reviews.title: ... have a pair of QC25 in-ear headphones which are excellent, but have the cable which is not a ...
customer_reviews.text: I have a pair of QC25 in-ear headphones which are excellent, but have the cable which is not a particular problem. However since buying the bluetooth QC35 find then equally good and comfortable without the tethering of wires. Sound is first class and reception from and connection to bluetooth couldn't be simpler. A quality product from Bose and well worth the higher than rival price. As the say you only get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.author: Euan Ross

customer_reviews.title: Pros and cons (compared to sony equivalent)
customer_reviews.text: I owned the equivalent Sony headphones before these, so my pros and cons are based on this experience:- PROs 1/ cheaper 2/ better noise cancelling 3/ more comfortable CONs 1/ non standard headphone jack 2/ sound quality is poor compared to Sony's I'd recommend Sony, I'll be buying them next time around.
customer_reviews.author: Mr Mark P Bennett

customer_reviews.title: Good but not worth the money
customer_reviews.text: Comfy but so many issues with these headphones: Bluetooth connectivity is poor occasionally. Lots of stuttering and lag Build quality is cheap, these will start squeaking and creaking after a few weeks and no amount of lube seems to fix it. The sound is amplified through the ear cups so every creak is super annoyibg
customer_reviews.author: S

customer_reviews.title: At last. A decent set of headphones for NC
customer_reviews.text: After trialling several different noise cancelling headphones I finally bit the bullit and invested in a pair of QC35’s. I know that they would be comfortable, having also owned a pair of Bose sound-link’s. Noise cancelling is great, cutting out all but the loudest noise completely and sufficiently dulling everything else. Very pleased.
customer_reviews.author: PeteBathoArt

product_meta.title: Bose QuietComfort 35 II Wireless Bluetooth Headphones, Noise-Cancelling, with Alexa voice control - Black
product_meta.description:
Color:BlackWhat happens when you clear away the noisy distractions of the world? Concentration goes to the next level. You get deeper into your music, your work, or whatever you want to focus on. That’s the power of Bose QuietComfort 35 wireless headphones II. Put them on and get closer to what you’re most passionate about. And that’s just the beginning. QuietComfort 35 wireless headphones II are now enabled with Bose AR — an innovative, audio-only take on augmented reality. Embedded inside your headphones is a multi-directional motion sensor. One that Bose AR can utilize to provide contextual audio based on where you are. Unlock Bose AR via a firmware update through the Bose Connect app. They’re Alexa-enabled, too, so you can enjoy entertainment, get information, and manage your day — all without looking at your phone. Adjust your level of noise cancelling between three settings using the Action button or the Bose Connect app. Volume-optimized EQ gives you balanced audio performance at any volume, and a noise-rejecting dual-microphone system provides clearer calls, even in noisy environments. And with easy Bluetooth pairing, 20 hours of battery life, and a durable, comfortable fit — you can keep the music or the quiet going all day long. Included: QuietComfort 35 II, carrying case, charging cable, audio cable for enjoying music without battery power.

* Bose AR availability and functionality varies. Bose AR enhanced apps are currently available for iPhone and iPad users only. Apps for Android devices are in development.
feature_bullets: Three levels of world-class noise cancellation for better listening experience in any environment
Alexa-enabled for voice access to music, information, and more
Noise-rejecting dual-microphone system for clear sound and voice pick-up
Balanced Audio performance at any volume
Hassle-free Bluetooth pairing, personalized settings, access to future updates, and more through the Bose connect app.Usb cable: 12 inch
Bose AR enabled — an innovative, audio-only version of augmented reality
For iPhone, iPad, and Android users, be sure your product’s firmware is up to date through the Bose connect app. Then you can access a showcase of Bose ar-enhanced apps with Links to download them.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.6 out of 5 stars24,843 ratings4.6 out of 5 stars
